Brother_002_AD_Fallback.synopsis: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.

Brother_002_Dead.synopsis: Johl has died either at the hag's or the player's hands. You can speak with him to learn of the hag and Mayrina.

AD_HagDisappear.synopsis: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.

Brothers_Recruitment.synopsis: The main dialogue for Demir and Johl. In their post ambush dialogue, the player has sided with them and the hag has disappeared. They want to save Mayrina but are overwhelmed and ill-equipped to deal with the situation. Player can accompany them or tell them that the player will handle it alone. The player can also abandon them to their fates.
Brothers_Recruitment.how_to_trigger: - Debug book: Go to region > Act 1 > HAG > Swamp start - HAG_HagAmbush_Confrontation.lsj should trigger automatically - tell Auntie Ethel she’s lying and finish the dialogue- When she’s gone, this dialogue should trigger automatically

AD_HagThankPlayer.synopsis: This occurs after the ambush. Player has sided with Ethel and killed the brothers. Player has either not spoken to Ethel yet OR they are wildshaped and cannot speak.

Confrontation.synopsis: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

AD_Argument.synopsis: This argument is the beginning of the situation. The three of them are yelling at each other out in the open. The brothers believe Ethel has taken their sister, while she is denying any knowledge of the girl.

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.synopsis: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.

Brother_001_Dead.synopsis: Demir, the eldest brother, has died. The following dialogue is a call to action for the player and directs them towards Mayrina and the hag.

Brother_001_AD_Fallback.synopsis: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.

ThankPlayer.synopsis:
This dialogue occurs if the player has sided with the hag in the ambush and saved her - by killing the brothers.
She's still in old lady mode, hamming up how upset she is, but there should be a hint on the last set of questions, about the gold, that this was an act and that there is more to her than meets the eye.
ThankPlayer.how_to_trigger: - Debug book: Go to region > Act 1 > HAG > Swamp start - HAG_HagAmbush_Confrontation.lsj will trigger- Side with Auntie Ethel and kill the brothers

Brother_002_AD_Fallback_0.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback_0.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

Brother_002_Dead_14.speaker: Narrator
Brother_002_Dead_14.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Brother_002_Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
Brother_002_Dead_24.text: *The corpse regards you with unrelenting malice.*

Brother_002_Dead_5.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_5.text: Looked so... innocent. But the teeth...

Brother_002_Dead_28.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_28.text: How did you plan on killing this hag?

Brother_002_Dead_27.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_27.text: Get her back... get Rina... back...

Brother_002_Dead_8.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_8.text: Maybe Mayrina wants to stay with Ethel?

Brother_002_Dead_15.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_15.text: Course... 'cause she promised... to bring Rina's husband... back. But hags... lie...

Brother_002_Dead_18.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_18.text: How do you know your sister is even here?

Brother_002_Dead_21.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_21.text: How do you know your sister is even here?

Brother_002_Dead_4.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_4.text: What drove your sister to leave?

Brother_002_Dead_12.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_12.text: She's scared she won't be... a good mum. But... she will. I know it...

Brother_002_Dead_16.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_16.text: Is the food here safe to eat?

Brother_002_Dead_7.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_7.text: Apples... so red... so delicious but... ngh
Brother_002_Dead_7.context: NodeContext: Noise of pain at the end

Brother_002_Dead_10.speaker: Player
Brother_002_Dead_10.text: I found Mayrina's note. Why didn't you stop her?

Brother_002_Dead_1.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_Dead_1.text: Tried. But Connor's death... was horrible. Guts... everywhere. Mayrina not... right since.

Brother_002_Dead_33.speaker: Narrator
Brother_002_Dead_33.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

AD_HagDisappear_0.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

Brothers_Recruitment_5.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_5.text: Bloody hells, she just disappeared. Ain't seen nothing like that before.
Brothers_Recruitment_5.context: NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue, The hag has vanished and your left terrified. This monster has your sister and the sheer magnitude of the situation is hitting you.

Brothers_Recruitment_4.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_4.text: She could shoot fireworks out of her backside for all I care; the hag has Rina.
Brothers_Recruitment_4.context: NodeContext: Your brother is afraid of the hag and you're having none of it. The hag has your sister and you'd fight a thousand of those monsters to save Mayrina - you're pissed that your brother isn't the same.

Brothers_Recruitment_14.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_14.text: Will someone please tell me what's going on?

Brothers_Recruitment_26.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_26.text: It's our sister - Mayrina. She is... well, she was in a bad way after her husband died.
Brothers_Recruitment_26.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. Your voice is gentle as you discuss the trauma Mayrina has gone through - obvious that you love her and are worried about her.

Brothers_Recruitment_8.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_8.text: Started saying weird things, like how she was gonna bring him back.
Brothers_Recruitment_8.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. You're scared but are hiding it beneath anger and frustration.

Brothers_Recruitment_32.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_32.text: Next thing, she's gone looking for the hag. Of all the stupid things to do.
Brothers_Recruitment_32.context: NodeContext: You're terrified for your sister and her child and are struggling to justify her reasons for disappearing. You think she's being foolish and naive.

Brothers_Recruitment_18.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_18.text: We haven't seen her since, and no good ever came from dealing with a hag.

Brothers_Recruitment_1.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_1.text: None of this matters, all right? We need to get her back. And fast.
Brothers_Recruitment_1.context: NodeContext: Your brother keeps talking and you're getting more angry and scared. You need to leave and find your sister - you're terrified of what will happen if you don't.

Brothers_Recruitment_11.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_11.text: Let me - I'll bring Mayrina home.

Brothers_Recruitment_23.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_23.text: Are you joking? I ain't got a clue who you are. No way I'm leaving Rina to you.
Brothers_Recruitment_23.context: NodeContext: The player has offered to get your sister back and you are offended and angry at the suggestion.

Brothers_Recruitment_28.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_28.context: NodeContext: Your brother has turned down an offer of help and you're trying to change his mind.

Brothers_Recruitment_25.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_25.text: Not a chance! We're getting her back on our own. Now, come on.
Brothers_Recruitment_25.context: NodeContext: Your brother has argued with you and you're shutting it down. Anger and determination. You're getting your sister back with or without the player's help.

Brothers_Recruitment_22.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_22.text: You're on your own. I have enough problems.

Brothers_Recruitment_2.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_2.text: And we've no need of a mouthy bastard.

Brothers_Recruitment_24.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_24.text: Come on, Demir. We'll make our own way.

Brothers_Recruitment_20.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_20.text: Come on, Demir. We'll make our own way.

Brothers_Recruitment_10.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_10.text: I'm sorry. I wish you luck in finding her.

Brothers_Recruitment_34.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_34.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to help and merely wished you look. You thank the player, afraid but determined to find your sister.

Brothers_Recruitment_21.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_21.text: To hells with that. We don't need luck or bloody help. Now, c'mon. We've a hag to kill.
Brothers_Recruitment_21.context: NodeContext: Gruff and angry. You're gonna find your sister and you don't need anyone's help or luck. Pissed.

Brothers_Recruitment_12.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_12.text: To hells with that. We don't need luck or bloody help. Now, c'mon. We've a hag to kill.
Brothers_Recruitment_12.context: NodeContext: Gruff and angry. You're gonna find your sister and you don't need anyone's help or luck. Pissed.

Brothers_Recruitment_30.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_30.text: Hags are dangerous, unnatural things. Even this place feels warped and twisted.

Brothers_Recruitment_9.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_9.text: A hag's magic is wild and chaotic. You'll be killed.

Brothers_Recruitment_31.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_31.text: I don't remember bloody asking you.
Brothers_Recruitment_31.context: NodeContext: Gruff and angry. You're gonna find your sister and you don't need the player commenting on the situation.

Brothers_Recruitment_19.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_19.text: Hags are incredibly powerful creatures. The fey should not be trifled with.

Brothers_Recruitment_15.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_15.text: You saying we should leave Rina to that monster, is that it?
Brothers_Recruitment_15.context: NodeContext: Gruff and angry. You're gonna find your sister and you don't need anyone's help or luck. Pissed.

Brothers_Recruitment_7.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_7.text: Hold on, Johl. Let them talk. What would you suggest?
Brothers_Recruitment_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing towards your brother to calm him as you look from him to the player. NodeContext: Your brother is pissed at the situation and you're trying to calm him. The player might be able to help and you need all the help you can get.

Brothers_Recruitment_17.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment_17.text: Knew it. You're full of it.
Brothers_Recruitment_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dismissive gesture towards the player, rolling eyes and frustrated.NodeContext: Player has told you to leave your sister behind. You're pissed off and angry. You would never do that.

Brothers_Recruitment_16.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_16.text: Thanks for the, erm, advice, but we can't do that.
Brothers_Recruitment_16.context: NodeContext: Player has suggested you leave your sister behind. Your brother is furious. You're trying to gracefully calm the situation and exit.

Brothers_Recruitment_27.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_27.text: We'll head there on our own.

Brothers_Recruitment_13.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment_13.text: We'll head there on our own.

Brothers_Recruitment_6.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment_6.text: Trust a more experienced soul. I'll find your sister.

AD_HagThankPlayer_0.text: Come here and let me see you proper, petal. We need to chat.

Confrontation_2.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation_34.speaker: Johl
Confrontation_34.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation_34.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation_44.speaker: Demir
Confrontation_44.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation_31.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation_31.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

Confrontation_7.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_7.text: *The old woman's face creases with false concern. You realise she's lying about seeing this girl, Mayrina.*

Confrontation_0.speaker: Demir
Confrontation_0.text: Stop this! We... we won't ask again.
Confrontation_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The two brothers ready their blades. Johl more confidently than Demir but It should be obviously that they don't really know what they're doing as they advance on the old woman. NodeContext: Fear in your voice as well as determiation. You're terrified of this monster but you want to save your sister.

Confrontation_26.speaker: Player
Confrontation_26.text: Stop! An illusion covers this swamp - who's responsible?

Confrontation_12.text: Wait - what? You saw through my magic?
Confrontation_12.context: NodeContext: Player has seen through her illusion. Shocked.

Confrontation_4.context: NodeContext: A curse - angry that your charade as been ruined.

Confrontation_46.context: NodeContext: Said with a dismissive tone, like the player isn't even worth your time or effort.

Confrontation_16.speaker: Player
Confrontation_16.text: How about you all just calm down. What's going on here?

Confrontation_22.speaker: Johl
Confrontation_22.text: Careful! Don't trust a word out of her mouth. Our sister went to the hag, and we ain't seen her since.
Confrontation_22.context: NodeContext: Careful is barked and forceful. You know Ethel is twisted and devious, this is a warning/order.

Confrontation_39.text: Hand over heart, I don't know their sister. I will gladly help you all look for her though.
Confrontation_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for the brothers and the settling her eyes on the player. Hand on her chest as she pleads. NodeContext: Pleading with the player and the brothers. You sound completely sincere and genuine, as if the thought of this missing girl is just tearing you up.

Confrontation_24.speaker: Johl
Confrontation_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand  moving towards weapon - both brothers preparing to charge but Demir looks more afraid and hesitant whereas Johl is gung ho and ready to go. NodeContext: Angry and on the brink of violence. You're a hair breadth from charging with your weapon.

Confrontation_30.speaker: Player
Confrontation_30.text: I won't let you hurt Auntie Ethel.

Confrontation_33.speaker: Player
Confrontation_33.text: I won't let you hurt this woman.

Confrontation_40.speaker: Player
Confrontation_40.text: Ethel, what did you do to their sister?

Confrontation_15.speaker: Player
Confrontation_15.text: Tell the truth - what did you do to their sister?

Confrontation_41.context: NodeContext: You are PISSED. A total drop of the old lady nice act with this word.

Confrontation_29.text: You were supposed to rush to my defence, love. Fat lot of good you are.
Confrontation_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a flourish, her form began to fade as she grinned, revealing too many teeth.NodeContext: The player has ruined her plan - she wanted to force the player to kill the brothers. Angry and annoyed.

Confrontation_18.text: Some advice? You ever darken my door, you'd best have that head bowed and an apology at the ready.
Confrontation_18.context: NodeContext: This is a menacing thrreat. The player knows there will be more than tea waiting for them. Big, evil smile.

Confrontation_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a cackle, she disappears with a flourish.

Confrontation_23.speaker: Player
Confrontation_23.text: Lower your weapons, I know this lady.

Confrontation_21.speaker: Player
Confrontation_21.text: Lower your weapons. She's just an old woman.

Confrontation_8.context: NodeContext: Player has rushed to your side and is about to fight. Calling out as you back away - fear and worry in your voice.

Confrontation_28.speaker: Demir
Confrontation_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning back , afraid and panicked. NodeContext: You're terrified - you didn't want a fight to begin with.

Confrontation_9.speaker: Johl
Confrontation_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Readying your weapon and gesturing for your brother to do the same. NodeContext: Taking control of the situation. Barking out an order to your brother to get it together and attack - angry in your voice.

Confrontation_17.speaker: Player
Confrontation_17.text: You're lying; you have seen this girl.

Confrontation_3.speaker: Player
Confrontation_3.text: This is nothing to do with me. Goodbye.

Confrontation_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brothers choke - frothing at the mouth as poison surrounds their heads.  They collapse on the ground - dead,

Confrontation_48.speaker: Player
Confrontation_48.text: Just because she's an old woman in a swamp, she's a hag? Lay off the fairy tales, lads.

Confrontation_5.speaker: Player
Confrontation_5.text: If you're lying about the girl, what's to say this isn't a disguise?

Confrontation_13.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_13.text: *Auntie Ethel's face creases with false concern. You realise she's lying about seeing this girl, Mayrina.*

Confrontation_38.text: Thank goodness you're here, sweetie. I - I don't know what's come over these boys.
Confrontation_38.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You've met the player before. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

AD_Argument_0.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument_0.text: She went to see you. We know she did.
AD_Argument_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

AD_Argument_3.text: You know absolutely nothing, you eejit.
AD_Argument_3.context: NodeContext: Said with a laugh as your shrug the accusations off.

AD_Argument_2.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument_2.context: NodeContext: Voice rising. You're getting more angry and you're tired of Ethel dodging your accusations.

AD_Argument_5.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument_5.text: Do you harass every old woman you meet?
AD_Argument_5.context: NodeContext: Arguing with the two brothers - you're trying to talk your way out.

AD_Argument_4.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument_4.text: Just tell us where she is. We don't want any trouble.
AD_Argument_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

AD_Argument_7.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument_7.text: But you're bloody getting some if you don't 'fess up.
AD_Argument_7.context: NodeContext: Voice rising. You're getting more angry and you're tired of Ethel dodging your accusations.

AD_Argument_6.text: You're both this close to getting a slap.
AD_Argument_6.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and unimpressed. You're having none of these brothers  and they're starting to piss you off.

AD_Argument_1.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument_1.text: Enough. We know you have her.
AD_Argument_1.context: NodeContext: You're getting tired of Ethel - and trying to sound threatening.

AD_Argument_8.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument_8.text: Please, we just want Mayrina back.
AD_Argument_8.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied_0.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied_0.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

Brother_001_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Brother_001_Dead_16.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Brother_001_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
Brother_001_Dead_30.text: *Eyes filled with fear, the corpse will not speak with you.*

Brother_001_Dead_25.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_25.text: Mam... Johl... Mayrina... and soon... a niece.

Brother_001_Dead_38.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_38.text: We're in the middle of nowhere. Why come here?

Brother_001_Dead_15.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_15.text: ... gotta get Mayrina back... for Mam...

Brother_001_Dead_33.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_33.text: Husband died... wants him... wants him back.

Brother_001_Dead_36.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_36.text: Why did you accuse Ethel of taking Mayrina?

Brother_001_Dead_12.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_12.text: Why did you accuse Ethel of taking Mayrina?

Brother_001_Dead_21.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_21.text: Because what... Mayrina wants... only hag... can give.

Brother_001_Dead_24.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_24.text: Heard her... screaming. But not... real.

Brother_001_Dead_2.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_2.text: Why are you so worried about your sister?

Brother_001_Dead_31.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_31.text: Why are you so worried about your sister?

Brother_001_Dead_37.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_37.text: This place seems strange. Anything I should be wary of?

Brother_001_Dead_23.speaker: Player
Brother_001_Dead_23.text: I found this letter. Who is Connor?

Brother_001_Dead_19.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_Dead_19.text: Connor was... her husband. Childhood... sweethearts. He died... and she nearly... broke.

Brother_001_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
Brother_001_Dead_3.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Brother_001_AD_Fallback_0.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_Fallback_0.context: NodeContext: Looking around, scared but trying not to show it.

Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied_0.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied_0.context: NodeContext: Your brother has died in front of you.

ThankPlayer_1.context: NodeContext: Player has just saved Ethel. This is exactly what she hoped would happen. Still playing up the old lady act -upset and frazzled and overcome with emotion.

ThankPlayer_7.text: I - I didn't mean for this to happen.

ThankPlayer_10.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer_10.text: What happened? It sounded like a heated argument.

ThankPlayer_6.text: Those poor boys were looking for their little sister, Mayrina. The girl who is... staying with me.
ThankPlayer_6.context: NodeContext: You've just admitted that two men have died because you lied. You're acting like heartbroken and upset, when this was always your plan.

ThankPlayer_2.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer_2.text: Do you know this 'Mayrina' they mentioned?

ThankPlayer_0.text: She's their little sister. And... she's staying with me.
ThankPlayer_0.context: NodeContext: You've just admitted that two men have died because you lied. You're acting like heartbroken and upset, when this was always your plan

ThankPlayer_14.text: This is all my fault. But I made a promise!

ThankPlayer_8.text: Mayrina begged me not to breathe a word if they came looking for her. And my word is my bond.
ThankPlayer_8.context: NodeContext: Seems genuinely upset - pleasing for understanding.

ThankPlayer_9.text: That poor thing will be distraught. We can't let her know - it'd break her poor heart.

ThankPlayer_5.text: I'd best get going, but please stop by my house. I'd like to thank you proper.

ThankPlayer_4.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer_4.text: The best thanks are paid in gold.

ThankPlayer_11.text: Oh, you're a cheeky pup, aren't you?
ThankPlayer_11.context: NodeContext: Player has asked for gold in return for saving her. You're delighted at how brazen they're being. This is said in a gentle and teasing tone - with a smile.

ThankPlayer_12.text: But I can respect someone who gets down to business.
ThankPlayer_12.context: NodeContext: This is true - admiration in your voice.

ThankPlayer_3.text: And such heroic deeds deserve proper thanks.
ThankPlayer_3.context: NodeContext: A sublle hint of amused menace here.

ThankPlayer_13.text: Why don't you stop by my house? I'll be sure to look after you. See you soon, dearie.
ThankPlayer_13.context: NodeContext: Cheeky wink and a grin.
